title: Intermittent Test: BlockValidatorTest
body:

### Description
See: https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/ConsenSys/teku/10362/workflows/ff86d293-ef26-49f9-874a-68713f7c07ca/jobs/65445


I think this is caused by use of `Constants` static fields in the static constructor for `BeaconState`.  Specifically:

```
  SszField ETH1_DATA_VOTES_FIELD =
      new SszField(
          9,
          "eth1_data_votes",
          () ->
              new SszListSchema<>(
                  Eth1Data.SSZ_SCHEMA,
                  Constants.EPOCHS_PER_ETH1_VOTING_PERIOD * Constants.SLOTS_PER_EPOCH));
```

Whenever `BeaconState` is first loaded, I twill use the values of `Constants.EPOCHS_PER_ETH1_VOTING_PERIOD * Constants.SLOTS_PER_EPOCH` and they will be permanently baked into the schema.  If we later load different contents the schema will be out of sync with the constants and we get errors like this one.

We have a `SpecDependent` class that can reset, but it doesn't actually reset the individual fields.

I can reproduce this by selecting `tech.pegasys.teku.statetransition.block.BlockImporterTest` and `BlockValidatorTest` in the IntelliJ project explorer then running them together.   `BlockImporterTest` sets `SLOTS_PER_EPOCH = 6` and while it resets the constants in an `@AfterAll` method, the `BeaconState` fields were initialised with the modified constants and don't get reset, so eth1 data votes max length remains set to 24.

I missed a detail in the way the `ETH1_DATA_VOTES_FIELD` is defined - the `SszField` actually takes a `Supplier` to get the schema which is what accesses `Constants`.  So if `SpecDependent` is reset, it will work.  There's lots of places we set new constants without also resetting `SpecDependent` though.

So #3561 changes `Constants.setConstants` to automatically call `SpecDependent.resetAll` to ensure they are in sync which should fix this category of intermittency.  There's ongoing work to remove the use of `Constants` entirely in favour of `SpecProvider` which will prevent this kind of issue.
